SEARCH
Package com.pjv.Helpers

Class Check

java.lang.Object
com.pjv.Helpers.Check
public class Check extends Object
This class provides various checks and validations for the game, including move validation, push and pull checks, and win condition checks.

  • Method Details

    • checkStep

      public boolean checkStep(int oldRow, int oldCol, int newRow, int newCol, Piece.Pieces type, Piece.Colors color, Player currPlayer, int steps)
      Validates a step move.
      Parameters:
      oldRow - the starting row of the piece
      oldCol - the starting column of the piece
      newRow - the target row of the piece
      newCol - the target column of the piece
      type - the type of the piece
      color - the color of the piece
      currPlayer - the current player
      steps - the number of steps left
      Returns:
      true if the step is valid, false otherwise

    • checkBounds

      public boolean checkBounds(int newRow, int newCol)
      Checks if the new position is within the bounds of the board.
      Parameters:
      newRow - the target row of the piece
      newCol - the target column of the piece
      Returns:
      true if within bounds, false otherwise

    • checkFreeSpace

      public boolean checkFreeSpace(int newRow, int newCol)
      Checks if the target space is free.
      Parameters:
      newRow - the target row of the piece
      newCol - the target column of the piece
      Returns:
      true if the space is free, false otherwise

    • checkPush

      public boolean checkPush(int oldRow, int oldCol, Piece.Colors color, Piece.Pieces type, Player currPlayer, int steps)
      Checks if a push can be performed.
      Parameters:
      oldRow - the starting row of the piece
      oldCol - the starting column of the piece
      color - the color of the piece
      type - the type of the piece
      currPlayer - the current player
      steps - the number of steps taken
      Returns:
      true if a push can be performed, false otherwise

    • checkTurn

      public boolean checkTurn(Piece.Colors color, Player currPlayer)
      Checks if it's the current player's turn.
      Parameters:
      color - the color of the piece
      currPlayer - the current player
      Returns:
      true if it's the current player's turn, false otherwise

    • checkOrthogonal

      public boolean checkOrthogonal(int oldRow, int oldCol, int newRow, int newCol)
      Checks if the move is orthogonal.
      Parameters:
      oldRow - the starting row of the piece
      oldCol - the starting column of the piece
      newRow - the target row of the piece
      newCol - the target column of the piece
      Returns:
      true if the move is orthogonal, false otherwise

    • checkRabbit

      public boolean checkRabbit(int oldRow, int newRow, Piece.Colors color)
      Checks if a rabbit move is valid (rabbits cannot move backwards).
      Parameters:
      oldRow - the starting row of the piece
      newRow - the target row of the piece
      color - the color of the piece
      Returns:
      true if the move is valid, false otherwise

    • checkFreezing

      public boolean checkFreezing(int oldRow, int oldCol, Piece.Pieces type, Piece.Colors color)
      Checks if a piece is frozen.
      Parameters:
      type - the type of the piece
      color - the color of the piece
      row - the row of the piece
      col - the column of the piece
      Returns:
      true if the piece is frozen, false otherwise

    • checkTraps

      public Move checkTraps()
      Checks all win condition.
      Returns:
      the move that caused the piece to get into trap

    • checkWinner

      public Piece.Colors checkWinner(Player currentPlayer)
      Checks all win condition.
      Parameters:
      currentPlayer - current player
      Returns:
      the color of the winner or null if none has won yet

    • checkImmobilization

      public Piece.Colors checkImmobilization()
      Checks if a player cannot make a move.
      Returns:
      the color of the player who has won

    • checkRabbitAtEnd

      public Piece.Colors checkRabbitAtEnd()
      Checks if any rabbit of the specified color has reached the opposite end of the board.
      Returns:
      the color of a rabbit that has reached the opposite end

    • checkNoRabbits

      public Piece.Colors checkNoRabbits(Player currentPlayer)
      Checks if there are no rabbits of the specified color on the board.
      Returns:
      color of the player that wins when the other one does not have rabbits
